snippet: A defined-benefit plan is ideal for small-business owners in their 50s who have saved little for retirement but can now afford to put aside a lot of money each year.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column says that defined-benefit plans are ideal for small-business owners in their 50s who have saved little for retirement but can now afford to put aside a lot of money each year.
lead_paragraph: A defined-benefit plan is ideal for small-business owners in their 50s who have saved little for retirement but can now afford to put aside a lot of money each year.

headline.print_headline: Save for Retirement In Just 10 Years? It’s Doable, but Risky
headline.seo: Defined-Benefit Plans Allow Fast Retirement Saving, but With Risks
headline.main: Save for Retirement in Just 10 Years? It’s Doable, but Risky
